articles.description:
Repairs to the Sanibel Causeway between Florida’s popular islands and the mainland were completed in just 15 days, more than a week ahead of schedule.
The causeway, the only road connecting islanders to the rest of the state, has been severely damaged by Hurricane Ian. Temporary repairs were completed early Wednesday and access to the bridge over the causeway was restored.
“Removing bureaucratic red tape and delivering on our promise to keep Sanibel Island operational has always been a priority. By restoring access on the causeway… residents will be better able to recover from this storm,” Republican Gov. Ron R. Ron DeSantis said.
The quick completion of the repairs required 100 FDOT workers and diving teams, who put in a combined 36,000 hours of work.
They used two dredgers, four barges, …
articles.title: Causeway repairs linking Sanibel Island to mainland Florida completed ahead of schedule

articles.description:
It’s its own pocket of sunshine.
Singer/songwriter Natasha Bedingfield is the latest star to buy a house in Bedford, NY.
Bedingfield and her husband, businessman Matt Robinson, recently paid $1.44 million for a five-bedroom apartmentfive-bathroom home on Mianus Bluff Drive. 
The 5,618 square foot Colonial was built in 1994 and sits on 5.57 acres;  its offerings include a chef’s kitchen that opens to a large outdoor deck as well as a library and finished basement.
Bedingfield (who was replaced by Compass broker Melissa Marcogliese) joins A-listers Matt Damon, who bought an $8.5 million four-bedroom apartment Westchester estate with his wife Luciana Barroso in July, and Ryan Murphy (once dubbed TV’s most powerful man for creating shows like “Glee” and “American Horror Story”), who bought the nearby Pound Ridge estate from Richard Gere in May for $28 million through Coldwell Banker listing broker Diane Hackert. 
Ryan Murphy (inset) bought his $28 million property from Richard Gere in July.   Sean Zanni/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images;  Ginnel Real Estate
During the height of the pandemic in 2020, Bedingfield and Robinson sold their house in Hollywood Hills for $2.53 million — $289,000 more than requested — in less than two weeks. 
The buyer was actress Sydney Tamiia Poitier, the daughter of actors Sidney Poitier and Joanna Shimkus.

Source Link
articles.title: Singer Natasha Bedingfield buys a house in Westchester

Withdrawal of staked ETH and lower gas fees are among the developments expected with the next critical improvements for the Ethereum network, the Shanghai upgrade.  The testnet version, dubbed Shandong, is now live.  Developers can now start working on implementations;  a process that is expected to continue until September 2023. 
This is the first major update since Ethereum consensus switched to proof-of-stake (PoS) in September after the Mainnet and Beacon chains merged.
Additionally, the upcoming update introduces a basic change to the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), the technology that powers network smart contracts.  EIP-3540, or EVM Object Format, is one of the most anticipated updates from the community because it separates encoding from data, which could be beneficial for on-chain…

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Newsrust)
articles.description:
Officials confirmed that their plane crashed at a car dealership in Marietta, Ohio, Tuesday morning, killing two people.
The plane crashed in the dealership parking lot just after 7 a.m., and the Ohio Highway Patrol said the dealership and some vehicles in the parking lot were damaged.
Officials said no one else was injured.
The 1974 Beechcraft King Air E90 took off from Columbus at 6:35 a.m. for Parkersburg, West Virginia.
Marietta is a town of approximately 13,000 people in southeastern Ohio, located north of Parkersburg on the Ohio River. The dealership is located in the main business district of the town. Some Marietta residents said they were awakened by the crash and saw a cloud of smoke rising into the sky.

The fire at the crash site has been extinguished by firefighters.
The Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash.
                        
The names of the pilots and passengers killed in the crash have not been released.

articles.description:
In this November 3, 2017 photo released by China's Xinhua news agency, President Xi Jinping (centre) visits the Central Military Commission (joint battle command centre in Beijing as part of an inspection tour.   
Wall Street Journal: China's Military Is Catching Up to the U.S. Is It Ready for Battle?  
China’s military is emerging as a true competitor to the U.S. under Xi Jinping. 
The People’s Liberation Army now has hypersonic missiles that evade most defenses, a technology the U.S. is still developing. Its attack drones can swarm to paralyze communications networks. China’s naval ships outnumber America’s, and it launched its third aircraft carrier this summer, the first to be designed and built in the country. Its defense budget is second only to the U.S.’s. China’s military has more serving members, at around 2 million, compared with just under 1.4 million in the U.S. 
The question for Mr. Xi, which he has raised in public, is whether those forces are ready for battle. 
China hasn’t fought a war since a brief border clash with Vietnam in 1979. Unlike American forces, who have fought for most of the past two decades in Iraq and Afghanistan, China’s service members have virtually no combat experience—which some Chinese leaders have referred to as a “peace disease.” Finding a solution short of actual war has been a priority for Mr. Xi, especially as he seeks to prepare the country for a potential showdown with the U.S.   
Read more .... 
 WNU Editor: I know my Chinese friends firmly believe that China's military capabilities now far exceed what the U.S. has in Asia. As to becoming a global military power equal to the U.S.. Quoting the above article .... 
.... Mr. Xi’s ambition, according to China’s most recent defense white paper, is to complete a modernization of the military by 2035 and turn it into a “world-class force” by 2049, the 100th anniversary of the ruling Communist Party’s founding.
articles.title: Has China's Military Caught Up To The U.S.?

articles.description:
Dan Rice, an advisor to the commander of Ukraine’s army, tells CNN that Russia is “trying to get to the negotiating table, to try to go back to the 2014 lines.” That means Crimea and the Donbas.
But “Ukraine won't have it. Ukraine wants all of their land back to the '91 lines.” pic.twitter.com/unyljYKJuB
— Aaron Maté (@aaronjmate) October 19, 2022
   Antiwar.com: American Advisor to Ukraine Commander Thinks Russia Wants Talks to Return to ‘2014 Lines’  
Dan Rice says Ukraine won't have it and wants Crimea and all of the Donbas  
Dan Rice, an American serving as an advisor to the commander of Ukraine’s armed forces, told CNN’s Outfront on Tuesday that he believes Russia is looking to negotiate to return to positions it controlled before the February 24 invasion. 
Rice made the comments when discussing Russia’s strikes on Ukrainian infrastructure and outlining what weapons he thinks Ukraine needs. “They are attacking the cities, trying to attack the grid, making it a very difficult winter,” he said. “They are trying to, in my opinion, trying to get to the negotiating table, to try to go back to the 2014 lines.”   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: Dan Rice is the President of a leader development company that is based at West Point. It is not hard to figure out who is paying him while advising the Ukraine's Commander-In-Chief.
articles.title: U.S. Advisor To Ukraine's Commander In-Chief Thinks Russia Wants Talks To Return To ‘2014 Lines’

articles.description:
DNYUZ/New York Times: Iran sends drone trainers to Crimea to aid Russia’s military 
WASHINGTON — Iran has sent trainers to occupied Ukraine to help Russians overcome problems with the fleet of drones that they purchased from Tehran, according to current and former U.S. officials briefed on the classified intelligence, a further signal of the growing closeness between Iran and Russia since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine. 
The Iranian trainers are operating from a Russian military base in Crimea where many of the drones have been based since being delivered from Iran. The trainers are from the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps, a branch of the Iranian military designated as a terrorist organization by the United States.   
Read more ....   
WNU editor: The White House is now publicly confirming these reports .... US: Iranian troops in Crimea backing Russian drone strikes (AP). 
U.S. Officials Say Iranian Trainers Are  in Crimea Helping Russia Use Drones Against Ukraine    
Iran has sent military trainers to Crimea to train Russian forces to use drones -- CNN

Iranians In Crimea 'Directly Engaged' In Helping Russia Use Drones To Attack Ukraine, White House Says -- RFE

articles.title: U.S. Officials Say Iranian Trainers Are  in Crimea Helping Russia Use Drones Against Ukraine

articles.description:
U.S. has viewed wreckage of kamikaze drones Russia used in Ukraine © Yasuyoshi Chiba/AFP/   
Washington Post: U.S. has viewed wreckage of kamikaze drones Russia used in Ukraine 
The U.S. government has examined the wreckage of Iranian-made drones shot down in Ukraine, deepening its insight into the unmanned craft that Russia has launched in a spate of kamikaze attacks on the country’s critical infrastructure, according to two U.S. officials. 
Information about the drones’ structure and technology could prove crucial in helping the United States and its Ukrainian allies better identify and ultimately defeat them before they can reach their targets. Officials said the process has been used in the past to study weaponry deployed by Iran’s proxies in conflicts in the Middle East. People interviewed for this report spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss sensitive intelligence collection.    
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: Not surprised that these drones have caught the interest of the US. They are having an impact .... Ukraine’s utilities threatened by Russia in war’s new phase (AP), and they are ushering a new phase .... The drone war: Iranian-supplied kamikaze drones usher in new era of warfare in Ukraine (CBS News).
articles.title: The U.S. Has Examined The Wreckage Of Iranian-Made Drones Shot Down In Ukraine

CNBC/Reuters: Lockheed Martin beats estimates on F-35 sales, maintains guidance 
* U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp reported better-than-expected quarterly revenue on Tuesday, helped by higher sales in its aeronautics unit which makes the F-35 fighter jet. 
* Ukraine is using the Maryland-based company’s High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) launchers and their ammunition to beat back Russia’s incursion. 
* Shares were up as much as 3.8% to $412.56 during morning trading in New York. 
WASHINGTON - U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin Corp reported better-than-expected quarterly revenue on Tuesday, helped by higher sales in its aeronautics unit, which makes the F-35 fighter jet, as the company sees demand for arms increasing after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. 
Shares were up as much as 3.8% to $412.56 during morning trading in New York  The maker of the High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) launchers and their ammunition, which Ukraine is using to beat back Russia’s incursion, saw lower profit margins compared with the same quarter a year ago. 
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: It is definitely a good time to be a arms manufacturer.
articles.title: Lockheed Martin Profiting From 'Global Conflict'. Beats Estimates On F-35 Sales

Presidents Erdogan and Putin apparently agreed to turn Turkey into a gas hub. Credit: Turkish Presidency
Euractiv: Washington rejects Putin’s call to make Turkey Europe’s gas hub 
The US has reacted negatively to a proposal made by Russian President Vladimir Putin to turn Turkey into a gas hub for the EU. 
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan recently backed the Kremlin’s idea of creating an international gas hub in Turkey and urged his government on 14 October to quickly present implementation plans. 
“We have continued to urge our allies to take steps to diversify their energy sources, to reduce energy reliance on Russia. And in the case of Turkey, we are working with them closely to assist in their own efforts to enhance energy security in the long term,” US State Department spokesperson Vedant Patel said on Wednesday.   
Read more ....

(French MOD photo) 
Defense News: Still tiny, the design of France’s next aircraft carrier takes shape 
PARIS — The French Ministry of Defense and industry leaders presented a first look, in model form, at the nation’s next-generation, nuclear-powered aircraft carrier this week during the biennial Euronaval trade conference here. 
The new carrier is expected to replace the French navy’s current aircraft carrier, the Charles de Gaulle, by 2038. Naval Group and Chantiers de l’Atlantique are building the ship together under the temporary joint venture MO Porte Avions, and Technic Atome will provide the two nuclear reactors to power the ship.

articles.description:
Washington Post: Norway on edge over drone sightings, arrest of son of Putin confidante 
BRUSSELS — Norwegian officials warned Thursday that there could be more arrests after at least seven Russians — including the son of a close associate of President Vladimir Putin — were detained in the span of weeks for flying drones or taking pictures near sensitive areas, prompting an investigation by the domestic intelligence service. 
The news comes as Norway and other countries move to secure critical infrastructure in the wake of the sabotage of the Nord Stream gas pipelines. 
It follows weeks of reports of drone sightings in its vast offshore oil and gas fields, as well as recent sightings at Norwegian airports. 
On Wednesday, Norway’s prime minister, Jonas Gahr Store, blamed foreign intelligence — and indirectly pointed a finger a Russia. 
“It is not acceptable that foreign intelligence is flying drones over Norwegian airports. Russians are not allowed to fly drones in Norway,” he said, according to Norwegian broadcaster NRK.    
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: The new reality in Norway. If you are a Russian national carrying a drone near critical infrastructure, you will be arrested. 
Norway On Alert After Drone Sightings Near Critical infrastructure And The Arrest Of Russian Nationals

articles.description:
Defense News: Worried China might seize Taiwan sooner, Navy chief pushes readiness  
WASHINGTON — The U.S. Navy has adopted a “fight tonight” mentality as both China and Russia grow more aggressive, the chief of naval operations said, meaning the service must become more ready and more lethal for a near-term conflict. 
Adm. Mike Gilday said he stands by prioritizing readiness, then lethality and then growing the size of the fleet, but said during remarks at the Atlantic Council Wednesday the potential for a conflict with China in the next couple years makes it important to do all three.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: No one in the US (civilian and military) is ready to "fight tonight".

CNBC: Japanese yen hits 150 against the U.S. dollar, weakest levels not seen since August 1990 
* The Japanese yen weakened past 150 against the U.S. dollar, a key psychological level, reaching levels not seen since August 1990. 
* The Bank of Japan’s two-day meeting is slated for next week. Policymakers have ruled out a rate hike in order to defend against further weakening of the currency. 
* On Thursday, Reuters reported Japanese Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said the government will take “appropriate steps against excess volatility.”

articles.description:
Rishi Sunak is among the favourites to take over as PMCredit: PA   
The SUN: 'GAME IS UP' Who could replace Liz Truss as UK Prime Minister now that she has stepped down? 
LIZ Truss has announced she will step down as Prime Minister after just 44 days in power. 
But who will replace Ms Truss now she has been forced out as Conservative Party leader? And who is the favourite for the job? 
The PM announced the news earlier today in a statement to the nation at Downing Street. 
It came after days of pressure, with MPs saying she had no choice but to go. 
A Tory leadership race will now begin and a new PM will be chosen in the next WEEK. 
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: This is my prediction from last week before Liz Truss resigned as PM (link here), and I am still holding to it ....
.... IMHO Liz Truss' days of being PM are numbered. I will not be surprised if she asked by senior Conservative members next week to resign. 
As to who will replace her? 
My money is on Rishi Sunak (link here). His image of being Britain's "Obama" will probably appeal to enough members in his party to support him as the next UK leader, as well as his globalist ties. 
As to the bigger question .... will Rishi Sunak be a good leader? 
I have my doubts. 
The decision to wage economic war against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine has devastated European economies, and in turn a number of EU governments have been defeated in recent elections. Rishi Sunak does not strike me as someone who has the understanding that the EU must reverse its Russia strategy, nor the leadership qualities to make the case on why this must be done. 
Another prediction. The Labor Party is well positioned to win the next election.
articles.title: Who Will Replace Liz Truss As UK Prime Minister?

articles.description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting with members of the Security Council via a video link at a residence outside Moscow, Oct. 19, 2022. Photo by Sputnik/Sergey Ilyin /Kremlin via REUTERS  
 Reuters: Putin boosts Russia's war footing with troops on back foot in Ukraine 
KYIV/MIKOLAIV — President Vladimir Putin ordered all of Russia to support the war effort in Ukraine on Wednesday, as the Russian-appointed administration of Kherson prepared to evacuate the only regional capital Moscow has captured during its invasion. 
Images of people using boats to flee the southern city were broadcast by Russian state TV, which portrayed the exodus – from the right to left bank of the River Dnipro – as an attempt to evacuate civilians before it became a combat zone. 
The Russian-installed chief of Kherson – one of four Ukrainian regions unilaterally claimed by Moscow where Putin declared martial law on Wednesday – said about 50,000-60,000 people would be moved out in the next six days. 
 Read more .... 
Update: Putin demands all-Russia war effort as he declares martial law in occupied Ukraine (Reuters)   
WNU Editor: There was a major shift today in the Russian media narrative on the conflict in Ukraine and the West. The message is that Russia is under attack from the West and its proxies in Ukraine, and the country must now prepare itself for war.
articles.title: With The Imposition Of Martial Law in Ukraine Followed By Other Measures That All Russians Must Now Follow, Putin Has Put Russia On A War Footing

The Atomic Weapons Establishment at Aldermaston, Berkshire   
SKY News: UK nuclear warhead maintenance staff to vote on strike action 
Nearly 2,000 staff at the Atomic Weapons Establishment (AWE) - a company that develops and services the Trident nuclear deterrent - will hold a ballot on industrial action for two weeks from 24 October. 
Workers who build and maintain the UK's nuclear warheads are to vote on strike action over a pay dispute. 
Nearly 2,000 staff at the Atomic Weapons Establishment (AWE) - a company that develops and services the Trident nuclear deterrent - will hold a ballot on industrial action for two weeks from 24 October.  It comes after staff at the Berkshire-based firm rejected a 5% pay increase and additional lump sum. 
Read more ....
WNU Editor: Inflation is over 10% in the UK. The offer of a 5% pay increase is actually a 5% decrease. If I was a worker at this company I would be voting to go on strike.
articles.title: Workers Who Build And Maintain The UK's Nuclear Warheads Are Voting On Strike Action

articles.description:
Bloomberg: Chinese Economists Tally Cost of Putin’s War, Warn on Deep Scars 
(Bloomberg) -- Russia faces a sharp and prolonged slump in its real income as international sanctions over President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine leave deep scars on its economy, according to a study by two Chinese academics. 
The severing of trade links and access to multinational production may cut real income by almost 12% and result in a “permanent decline in real gross domestic product” for Russia, Xiayi Du and Zi Wang from Shanghai University of Finance and Economics said in the study published in the journal Economics Letters.
“This welfare loss is mainly due to losing access to foreign final goods and intermediates,” they said. 
One of the most downbeat assessments to date of the fallout from Putin…
articles.title: Chinese Economists Calculate The Cost To Russia For Its War Against Ukraine

articles.description:
Washington Post: McCarthy signals GOP-led House likely to oppose more aid to Ukraine 
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) is signaling that if Republicans win the House majority in next month’s midterm elections, the GOP is likely to oppose more aid to Ukraine in its war with Russia. 
Since the invasion in February the majority of congressional Republicans and Democrats have united in authorizing billions of dollars in U.S. military and humanitarian assistance to Kyiv as a geopolitical and moral stand against Vladimir Putin’s aggression.    
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: If the US ends its military involvement/participation/direction in the Russia - Ukraine war, the Ukraine government will fall faster than the Afghan government did when the Taliban launched their offensive in the spring of 2021 to take back power. 
As to the remarks from House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.). This is all talk. All Democrats and most Republicans support this war .... Armed Services Committee Republican says ‘vast majority’ of GOP supports US assistance to Ukraine (The Hill). 
The only Republican politician who is asking the right questions on where is all of this money and weapons are going to is Senator Rand Paul and maybe one or two Republicans in the House. 
Will A Republican Run Congress Oppose More Aid To Ukraine?   
Prospective Speaker McCarthy: GOP won't write Ukraine a 'blank check'; Russian official warns of Ukraine offensive in Kherson: Live updates -- USA Today  
Ukrainian officials 'shocked' as Republicans threaten tougher line on aid -- Financial Times  
Kevin McCarthy Warns Of Ukraine Aid Cuts If GOP Wins -- Huffington Post  
Ukraine aid under threat in Republican-controlled House -- Axios  
House Republicans divided over aid to Ukraine ahead of midterms -- The Guardian
articles.title: Will A Republican Run Congress Oppose More Aid To Ukraine?
